sentence.idiomatic: I estimate it will still be another week or two until you can get your visa.
It's so late, I reckon he won't come.
Today it's the weekend. I would guess that there will be a lot of people out having a good time.
I don't know where he went. Why don't you call him and find out.
Hurry up and chase after her. Otherwise, it will be too late.
I still have some things to finish. Why don't you go first?
This idiom is not frequently used, as long as you know what it means, that's enough.
I only remember by heart a few of the phone numbers I use more often.
What translation software do you use most often?
Perhaps you will be able to use these books when you are overseas.
Although you can't use this knowledge now, later you definitely will be able to use it.
You should learn a few sentences that you can use every day.
I want one bouquet each of roses and lilies.
I bought an insurance policy for both mom and dad.
We have every color of bag in our shop.
The clothes plus the pants--altogether it's 300 RMB.
It took us altogether five days to finish this project.
How many people attended her wedding in total?
Do you sell batteries?
Yes, over there.
Do you know what size I need for a TV remote control?
It depends. Some are AA and some are AAA.
My remote control is quite big. I would guess that it takes AA.
Or maybe you should buy both. AA and AAA are the most commonly used batteries. You'll be able to use them for other things.
How much?
AA are 3.5 RMB each; AAA are 3 RMB each.
All right. I'll have two of each.
OK. That comes to 13 RMB.
